alert.note: Alert for Avery; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 25 at 3:29AM EST until December 25 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 to 20 below zero. * WHERE...Avery, Yancey and Mitchell Counties in the northern North Carolina Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
